sentences.english: Don’t become cynical, but verify everything you can. The lesson learned: make sure you know who it is you’re dealing with and what their motives may be.
sentences.chinese: 不要愤世嫉俗，但是近你所能核实一切。

sentences.english: Your inner cynic can accelerate your learning
sentences.chinese: 内心的愤世嫉俗可以加速你的学习。

sentences.english: Some women who answered the questions were found to be snikly hostel cynically hostile, or highly untrusting of others.
sentences.chinese: 一些回答问题的妇女愤世嫉俗或者极度不相信他人。

sentences.english: Your inner cynic can protect you and alert you to BS
sentences.chinese: 内心的愤世嫉俗可以保护你，并提醒你的无知。

sentences.english: Your inner cynic can help you to observe reality more accurately
sentences.chinese: 内心的愤世嫉俗可以帮助你更仔细的观察到真相。

sentences.english: Some women whoansweranswered the questions were found to besynicallyhostlecynicallyhostile, or highly untrusting of others.
sentences.chinese: 受调查的一些女性愤世嫉俗或非常不信任他人。

sentences.english: Loss has not embittered him or made him cynical.
sentences.chinese: 然而控制权的丧失并未使他痛苦不堪或愤世嫉俗。

sentences.english: Just because I am not a misanthrope?
sentences.chinese: 难道仅因为我确非愤世嫉俗之辈？

sentences.english: Your inner cynic can help you to focus your problem-solving efforts
sentences.chinese: 内心的愤世嫉俗可以帮助你集中精力解决问题。

sentences.english: Therefore he earned the fame of being a misanthrope.
sentences.chinese: 因此他获得了愤世嫉俗者的名声。

sentences.english: If people are irrational in their attitudes to reality, they may become cynical.
sentences.chinese: 如果人们对现实的态度失去理性就会变得愤世嫉俗。

sentences.english: Yes, I'm both a romantic and a cynic.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我是既浪漫又愤世嫉俗的。

sentences.english: Why are you always so cynical?
sentences.chinese: 为什么你如此的愤世嫉俗？

sentences.english: You might think she’d be cynical by now.
sentences.chinese: 你也许会认为她现在一定愤世嫉俗。

definition: to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
angry youth/positive term used to describe young Chinese with extreme nationalistic tendencies/see also 糞青|粪青[fen4 qing1]
to trifle without respect (idiom); to despise worldly conventions/frivolous
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
noble and virtuous/aloof from politics and material pursuits
unkind/harsh/cutting/mean/acrimony/to embezzle by making illegal deductions
great bitterness, deep hatred (idiom); deeply ingrained long-standing resentment
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
to moan about imaginary illness/fussing like a hypochondriac/fig. sentimental nonsense
